reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Business Practices and Consumer Protection Act
reg:regulation.reg:title:
Business Practices and
Consumer Protection Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definition
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Business Practices and Consumer Protection Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Spouses
bcl:section.bcl:text: Persons who live together in a marriage-like relationship are spouses for the purposes of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed provisions of the Act — contraventions relating to disclosure

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 164 (1) (a) and (5) (a) [administrative penalties] of the Act, the following provisions of the Act are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 19 [required contents of direct sales contract, future performance contract and time share contract];
section 20 (2) [supplier to give copy of direct sales contract];
section 23 (2) [required contents of future performance contract];
section 23 (3) [supplier to give copy of future performance contract];
section 24 (1) [required contents of continuing services contract];
section 26 (1) [supplier to give copy of time share contract];
section 34 (2) [supplier to give copy of funeral contract];
section 34 (3) [supplier to inform consumer of substitution regarding funeral contract];
section 36 (1) [required contents of preneed cemetery or funeral services contract];
section 36 (2) [supplier to give copy of preneed cemetery or funeral services contract];
section 37 [special provisions for right of interment];
section 43 (1) [required contents of interment right contract];
section 43 (2) [supplier to give copy of interment right contract];
section 47 (2) [disclosure of information for distance sales contract in electronic form];
section 48 (1) [supplier to give copy of distance sales contract];
section 48 (2) [required contents of distance sales contract];
section 62 (2) [disclosure of interest-free or grace period in advertisements];
section 62 (3) [disclosure respecting grace period in advertisements];
section 89 (4) [revised disclosure statement — mortgage loan renewals].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A supplier is prescribed as subject to the imposition of an administrative penalty for a contravention of a provision referred to in subsection (1) (a), (c), (e), (g), (i), (j), (l), (m) and (r).
A credit grantor is prescribed as subject to the imposition of an administrative penalty for a contravention of the provision referred to in subsection (1) (s).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Continuing contraventions
bcl:section.bcl:text: The director may impose administrative penalties on a daily basis for continuing contraventions.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Due diligence
bcl:section.bcl:text: A notice imposing an administrative penalty for the following contraventions must be cancelled in respect of those contraventions if the person on whom the notice was served demonstrates to the satisfaction of the director that the person exercised due diligence to prevent the contravention:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a contravention of provisions referred to in section 189 (2), (3) and (4) of the Act;
a contravention of section 189 (5) of the Act;
a contravention of section 164 (1) (b) to (f) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Failure to pay an administrative penalty
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a person fails to pay an administrative penalty as required under section 167 [due date of penalty] of the Act, the director, before filing the notice of penalty with a court in accordance with section 168 (2) [enforcement of administrative penalty] of the Act, must impose an additional administrative penalty equal to 10% of the unpaid administrative penalty.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption — credit reporting

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, collection agent has the same meaning as in section 125 of the Act.

A collection agent who, while collecting or attempting to collect a debt for a creditor, reports credit information of the debtor to the creditor is exempt in respect of that report from the application of Part 6 [Credit Reporting] of the Act and any regulations relating to that Part.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Credit reporting exemptions when debt due to government

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 107 (1) [consent for report] of the Act does not apply in respect of a debt due to the government.

On requesting a report to be provided under section 108 (1) (a) (i) of the Act, the government must promptly notify the individual who is the subject of the report that a request for credit information has been made.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed additional sources of revenue
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 139 (2) (c) [establishment of Consumer Advancement Fund] of the Act, the following additional sources of revenue are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a payment that is directed to be made into the Consumer Advancement Fund in accordance with an undertaking under the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 56 (2) (b) [application of Divisions 1 to 3 of Part 10 — inspections and enforcement] of the Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act;
section 14 (2) (e) [inspections and enforcement — undertakings] of the Ticket Sales Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a payment that is directed to be made into the Consumer Advancement Fund in accordance with a compliance order under the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 56 (2) (c) of the Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act;
section 14 (2) (f) [inspections and enforcement — compliance orders] of the Ticket Sales Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed purposes for expending Consumer Advancement Fund
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 140 (e) [payments from Consumer Advancement Fund] of the Act, the following purposes are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purpose of research related to consumer protection;
for the purpose of paying grants to organizations for the delivery of services related to consumer protection;
to pay the costs associated with planning or implementing programs related to consumer protection;
to pay the costs associated with inspections or hearings that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: relate to a business, industry, trade, profession, occupation or employment that is not a designated activity as defined in section 142 [definition] of the Act, and
do not result in an undertaking, compliance order or administrative penalty;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purpose of educating consumers and suppliers about any matters relating to the Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act;
for the purpose of increasing compliance with the Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act;
to pay the costs associated with imposing an administrative penalty under the Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act;
for the purpose of research related to consumer protection under the Ticket Sales Act;
for the purpose of paying grants to organizations for the delivery of services related to consumer protection under the Ticket Sales Act;
to pay the costs associated with planning or implementing programs related to consumer protection under the Ticket Sales Act;
to pay the costs associated with inspections or hearings that do not result in an undertaking, compliance order or administrative penalty under the Ticket Sales Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed purpose for expending Consumer Financial Education Fund
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 141.5 (d) [payments from Consumer Financial Education Fund] of the Act, the purpose of paying grants to organizations for the provision of financial education to consumers respecting high-cost financial services, including payday loans, high-cost credit products and cheque cashing services, is prescribed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Director's report
bcl:section.bcl:text: Each year the director must publish a report in respect of the Consumer Financial Education Fund for the previous calendar year or other period determined by the director that includes the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total amount paid to the fund in the period by applicants for a licence under the High-Cost Credit Products Regulation or the Payday Loans Regulation;
the total amount of any interest or other income of the fund in the period;
the total amount paid from the fund in the period

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: for the purpose of providing financial education to consumers respecting high-cost financial services, including payday loans, high-cost credit products and cheque cashing services,

to pay grants to organizations for the provision of financial education to consumers respecting high-cost financial services, including payday loans, cheque cashing services and high-cost credit products,
for the purpose of increasing compliance with Parts 6.1 [Payday Loans], 6.2 [Government Cheque Cashing Fees] and 6.3 [High-Cost Credit Products] of the Act, and
to pay the costs of administering the fund.
